subject: Re: Help,what's wrong with my TDD practice in my daily life?
msgSnippet: ... reverse ... software ... befoe.Maybe I ... complex ... that ... step ... just ... in ... refactor ... the ... duplication. ... agree with I don t notice
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> On 9/12/07, hyysguyang <hyysguyang@...> wrote:
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Ilja Preuss <it@> wrote:
> > > hyysguyang wrote:
> > > > In my opinion about the requirement,I think I should not
reverse
> > any
> > > > other sentence but
> > > > the 'TDD is a software devolopment technology',so I needn't
> > write so
> > > > many test but the test below
> > > >
> > > > @Test public void testReverse(){
> > > > StringReverser sr=new StringReverser();
> > > > String str = "Tdd is a software devolopment
> > > > technology";
> > > > Assert.assertEquals("technology devolopment
software
> > a is
> > > > Tdd",sr.reverse(str));
> > > > }
> > > > after this I refactor to the final code described
befoe.Maybe I
> > make
> > > > a large jump.
> > >
> > > If this is the only requirement, your final code was more
complex
> > then
> > > needed. A hardcoded return value already would have fulfilled
that
> > > requirement.
> > >
> > > Cheers, Ilja
> > >
> >
> > Yes ,you got my idea .Do you mean that I should stop at forth
step
> > refactor because of need not refactor indeed?In fact I confused
just
> > here?I don't known should to refactor.
> >
> > I think what you say is as below:
> >
> > public Object reverse(String str) {
> > return "technology devolopment software a is Tdd";
> > }
> >
> > But in my opinion ,I think that string 'Tdd is a software ...'
in
> > test is duplicated with before string in some ways ,then I
refactor
> > and generate the final complex code .May be I made a mistakes on
> > here,do you think so£¿
>
> There is duplication between the two strings but the refactoring
> (putting the bits into a String array) removed the duplication at
the
> cost of readability. And, sometimes, readability trumps
duplication.
>
> Lasse
>
> --
> Lasse Koskela
> * Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *
> * Reaktor Innovations * http://www.ri.fi/en *
>

agree with I don't notice the readability , From this point I did
shouldn't refactor.
